messages.msgSnippet: I don t agree that negotiating and compromising are giving power away.  I totally agree with you Elissa. Actually Ren, You agree with Tia!! LOL I think I
messages.messageBody:
I don't agree that negotiating and compromising are giving power away. >>

I totally agree with you Elissa.

Actually Ren,
You agree with Tia!! LOL I think I forgot to put those <<>> in.
~Elissa Cleaveland
"It is nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction
have
not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A. Einstein

messages.subject: Reluctant husband
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/18/02 8:15:31 AM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/18/02 8:15:31 AM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
>Also acting like grown women with power instead of giving it away.

I don't agree that negotiating and compromising are giving power away. >>

I totally agree with you Elissa.
I think that the art of negotiation is vital in all of our relationships.
I need to honor and respect his needs/desires as much as my own.
And where he isn't as well informed, he does back off and let me have my way.
But we have to discuss it to figure out who is more informed and what the
intentions are. He cares very much for his children too....it's not fair to
say that I'm giving power away when I respect my dh. It's not about power.
It's about love and respect.
Ren
